alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; Laramie Valley; North Snowy Range Foothills; Shirley Basin; Snowy Range; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 7:29PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Carbon and southern Albany Counties through 900 PM MDT... At 728 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles south of Medicine Bow to Nash Fork Campground. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Laramie, Rock River, Tie City Campground, Vedauwoo, Bosler, Brooklyn Lake, Tie Siding, Brooklyn Lake Campground, Sugar Loaf Campground, Libby Creek Campground, University Of Wyoming War Memorial Stadium, Pumpkin Vine, Deep Creek Campground, Vedauwoo Campground, Centennial, Nash Fork Campground, Baldy Peak, Lake Hattie Reservoir, The Buttes and North Fork Campground. This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 265 and 332. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
